ac612c9a-9513-47b7-9386-7a1ae1b9ffb1.description: This conference badge represents gain knowledge and skills that will expand their understand of social justice and topics and issues related to communities of color and those from oppressed groups. Participants have enhanced their leadership skills and learn valuable strategies for provide support and advocacy, relationship building, grassroots community organizing, and how to incorporate diversity, equity and inclusion into their personal and professional spaces.
ac612c9a-9513-47b7-9386-7a1ae1b9ffb1.name: Power in Diversity Leadership Conference

issuer.summary: issued by St. Cloud State University

badge_template_activities.title: This conference badge represents gain knowledge and skills that will expand their understand of social justice and topics and issues related to communities of color and those from oppressed groups. Participants have enhanced their leadership skills and learn valuable strategies for provide support and advocacy, relationship building, grassroots community organizing, and how to incorporate diversity, equity and inclusion into their personal and professional spaces.

6f534982-71ec-470d-9242-5417d719607d.description: This credential is awarded to individuals who attended the 2020 STAR Symposium. The STAR Symposium is a virtual conference sponsored by the Minnesota State Colleges and Universities. View the 2020 STAR Symposium Conference Guide for more information.
6f534982-71ec-470d-9242-5417d719607d.name: STAR Symposium 2020-Participant

issuer.summary: issued by St. Cloud State University

skills.name: Faculty Support For Face-to-face Courses And/or Programs
Providing Faculty Support For Blended Courses And/or Programs
Providing Faculty Support For Online Courses And/or Programs

9fcb125b-bdd9-47cc-912c-bd65642871fc.description: The trainings provide essential tools and develop skills for professional settings, community organizing and social justice work, and leadership development. Trainings will guide individuals to transform psychological trauma into nonviolent power with positive, productive alternatives to revenge to prepare individuals and organizations for truth-telling, conciliation, and repairing harm for healed.
9fcb125b-bdd9-47cc-912c-bd65642871fc.name: Peace and Justice

issuer.summary: issued by St. Cloud State University

alignments.name: Peace and Justice
alignments.description: Peace and Justice training mission is to instigate, train, and support racially, sexually, religiously, ethnically, culturally, and economically diverse individuals and organizations to become trauma-informed, resilience-oriented, and restorative justice-focused, empowering communities in Minnesota, the USA, and around the world.

badge_template_activities.title: Trainings are offered by a professional organization and individuals will develop the critical skills necessary to engage in numerous types of social justice work, develop their activism, enhance community organizing skills, integrate self-care, and practice personal reflection

2fa363bf-5c37-40f7-bbf0-a3bbb5c8d103.description: Earners of the Initiative badge have exhibited foundational competency in their initiative and leadership skills. Earners are able to demonstrate self-efficacy, show the capacity to identify needs and respond proactively; demonstrate self-awareness; learn from both "failure" and "success," seeing them as opportunities to learn and develop; lead without an official "leader" role or title; motivate others and catalyze necessary action.
2fa363bf-5c37-40f7-bbf0-a3bbb5c8d103.name: Initiative

issuer.summary: issued by St. Cloud State University and authorized by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

entity.name: Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

alignments.name: Education Design Lab 21st Century Skills Micro-credentials

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed four performance-based assessments, grounded in workplace scenarios, during a for-credit course or a co-curricular activity associated with a Minnesota State college or university.  Those assessments evaluated their abilities to A) lead without title, B) act as catalyst, C) demonstrate self-awareness, and D) learn from experience.

0867be1d-f16a-43ba-80bc-c72a082a6628.description: Earners of the Collaboration badge have exhibited foundational competency in their collaboration and teamwork skills. Earners have shown their capacity to work productively with different individuals and groups toward a common goal; know how to strengthen relationships by incorporating diverse perspectives; use active listening skills; focus on solutions rather than problems.
0867be1d-f16a-43ba-80bc-c72a082a6628.name: Collaboration

f059bdc5-6627-44af-9405-4fd465cd374f.description: Earners of the Critical Thinking badge have exhibited foundational competency in their critical thinking skills. Earners have shown their capacity to gather and assess relevant information; identify patterns; question assumptions; and draw conclusions.
f059bdc5-6627-44af-9405-4fd465cd374f.name: Critical Thinking

5d23bcf8-a436-4561-b411-afec2350fad1.description: Earners of the Oral and Written Communications badge have exhibited foundational competency of their verbal and nonverbal communication skills. Earners can speak with clarity and precision in formal and informal contexts; use stories to communicate ideas; are aware of their audience; use appropriate tone and word choice; are active listeners who can "hear" both what is said and what is not said; can use body language effectively; can write effective, professional emails.
5d23bcf8-a436-4561-b411-afec2350fad1.name: Oral and Written Communications

9cbcd927-54f8-4f74-a8f6-0c65582f5666.description: Earners of the Empathy badge have exhibited foundational competency in their ability to listen actively, both to what is said explicitly and communicated non-verbally; recognize what others need and value; validate feelings and perceptions; and incorporate diverse perspectives.

2e9f361d-c1dd-4eee-a8ed-e7e44923ce03.description: Earners of the Intercultural Fluency badge have exhibited the foundational competency of recognizing and challenging their own cultural biases. Earners have shown their capacity to demonstrate cognitive and effective openness; evaluate their own performance; recognize their motivations; manage their anxiety; work effectively in multicultural settings; challenging their own thinking; and maximize group effectiveness.
2e9f361d-c1dd-4eee-a8ed-e7e44923ce03.name: Intercultural Fluency

672e51ce-0ff7-461b-998a-44ef0bd2856b.description: Earners of the Resilience Badge have exhibited the foundational competencies to learn from experience; exhibit flexibility; demonstrate self awareness; and focus on solutions.

f9bbc5e7-7bfb-47bc-b94c-2b914892b8a4.description: Earners of the Creative Problem Solving badge have exhibited foundational competencies in both divergent and convergent thinking; identified patterns that may not be obvious; managed ambiguity; and applied an iterative process for generating, testing and refining ideas. Earners have shown their capacity to generate fresh ideas and apply a process for evaluating them; and gathering information before settling on solutions prematurely.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed four performance-based assessments, grounded in workplace scenarios, during a for-credit course or a co-curricular activity associated with a Minnesota State college or university.  Those assessments evaluated their abilities to: A) utilize both divergent and convergent thinking, B) identify patterns that may not be obvious, C) manage ambiguity, and D) apply an iterative process for generating, testing and refining ideas.

d458a1fa-ab93-4d0d-a563-7e2a846bace7.description: Earners will demonstrate base-level competency in ethical decision-making by: Completing a values assessment called the ELI Applying the ELI framework ethical dilemmas, in class and on their own Becoming aware of their ethical blindspots and the fraud triangle Creating a personal ethics code Earners will participate in a discussion with a convicted white-collar felon and attorneys who are knowledgable about the legal process and/or the ramifications of ethical breaches in the workplace.
d458a1fa-ab93-4d0d-a563-7e2a846bace7.name: Ethical Decision-Making

issuer.summary: issued by St. Cloud State University

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Ethical Lens Inventory Assessment
Participate in a class discussion about the Ethical Lens Model

Complete a case study which asks students to correctly identify the ethical dilemma, separate facts and assumptions, evaluate the ethical dilemma from the four different dimensions and apply the correct lens to address and resolve the ethical conflict
Prepare a personal ethics code and obtain feedback from 5 parents/friends on the values identified
Attend a presentation by a white collar felon or other business representative on the consequences of poor ethical decision-making
